result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliott A Shannon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs 
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elliott A Shannon

records.addlTxt: CHECK RETURNED & VOIDED, FUNDS APPLIED TO 16CM351
Disbursements Journal Final
Joint and Several

Defendant Elliott A Shannon in court with attorney Anne Renc, on behalf of Atty Arendt. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 16CM-142 and 16CM-351.

9:02 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Hess states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead in 16CM-351 to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in
16CM-142 would be amended to theft ordinance -  2.1.3

State requests bond posted to be applied to fines/costs.
Court states concerns about the fine amount requested in 16CM-142.

Atty Renc concurs with plea agreement.
Defendant concurs with plea agreement.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM-351: Count 1: GUILTY
16CM-142 - amended charge of theft 2.1.3 : GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CM-351: Count 1: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia
16CM-351: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-142: Amended to theft - county ordinance 2.1.3

Atty Hess makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM-351:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $150 plus costs
Provide DNA Sample
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan and comply with the plan

16CM-142:
Pay fine of $20 plus costs
Restitution of $86.41 to be taken out of bond before being applied to fine/costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan and comply with the plan

Plea hearing on September 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Elliott A Shannon

Defendant Record Update
filed by Atty Patrick Arendt
Pre-trial conference on September 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Bond covers both 16CM142 & 16CM351.

Defendant Elliott A Shannon appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Michael Daniel Zell appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 16CM142, 16CM351

Court reviews the files. 
Questions the Defendant re: non-appearance. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant further re: failure to notify clerk of courts of change of address. 

BY THE COURT:  Court quashes the warrants. 

Atty Zell requests the $200 cash alternative be the bond.   
Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Has contacted the Public Defender for new representation.  
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  $200 cash bond set to cover both files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.
